website_summaries.verdict: Amazing price, compatibility, and customer support. As long as you don't have your heart set on a multi-color bulb, you won't find a smart bulb that offers more.
pros: About half the price of other smart bulbs with similar capabilities
Works with numerous smart devices, including Alexa and Echo
It's easy to set up – no hub required
Free tech support and a 2-year warranty
cons: Some reports of flickering on bright settings

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say this is really a waste of money. I set it up and the wifi signal was excellent and setup went without a hitch. But it constantly "loses contact" and is inoperable using the Kasa app. with the error message "device unreachable". I am certain I have a good wifi signal as my Blink cameras and sensi thermostat work flawlessly. This is the second tp link product I have purchased with exactly the same result, the other being the tp link smart plug. I rated this two stars because they can be scheduled and set with on and off times and that does work but for the price paid, these are very expensive timers
customer_reviews.author: Bergen County Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Normally great bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these at home. I ordered two last week. Setting up the first one I noticed the kelvin range was not what it should be. Installing the second one proved it - the first bulb didn't even get close to the warm 2700k that the second one did. So I contacted Amazon and arranged for a replacement/return which they did happily. So, it's a good product - just make sure that if you buy the tunable white bulbs that they reach the range they should, as some might be defective in this regard.
customer_reviews.author: BGB

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these bulbs. I put one in the lamp and it wouldn't pair with my phone or Alexa. So I turned it off (you turn them on and off 4 times to reset them). It promptly blew and also took out my surge protector. Fortunately, the surge protector did its job and none of my electronics were harmed. It might have been a defective bulb, but I'm not wiling to find out by trying the other one.
customer_reviews.author: MoodyMuse

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding smart bulb
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this smart bulb so that I could integrate it with Alexa and control the light using my voice, and also to control the light from my smartphone remotely. Setup was very easy, and all I needed to do was screw the bulb into the socket, turn on the power, and the Kasa app connected to the smartphone in just a few seconds. No hub was needed. I could adjust the color temperature and brightness right from my phone or using Alexa. I would recommend this product to anyone who needs a smart bulb but doesn't want to go through the trouble of purchasing and setting up a smart home hub.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is not good
customer_reviews.text: The bulb as a two year warranty and mine stopped working (just would not turn on) after about a year. Heads-up - keep the box or register the serial number because it is not on the bulb and you will need it for returns). Once you get someone one the phone or to chat, once they verify that you know how to turn on a light bulb, you get sent to a supervisor that you deal with through e-mail who asks different questions about every 2 days. All this for one light bulb! I'm sure they just want you to give up. Anyway.....nice to have a bulb that works without a hub, but customer service is really bad.
customer_reviews.author: Tucker

customer_reviews.title: No longer works remotely
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these bulbs in 4/2017. They were consistently used until 11/2018. The light work. Thank h they sure do. But the remote functionality and ability to dim the lights quit 11:2018. I didn’t buy the bulbs for the light. I could buy any bulb for that purpose. I bought the bulbs for the remote and dismantle functions. I am so angry at this loss I’m going to look at other sellers. One and a half years use out of the expensive light bulbs is unacceptable! I am so angry about this. I just had to let you all know.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Van Fleet

customer_reviews.title: It Works!!!!! Sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: When they worked they were cool. Pieces of garbage never synced up properly or held the connection for more than a week or two. I'll revisit this idea after enough people complain about it and the tech improves. Probably with a different company. I'm writing a review 3 years after I bought them because I just found them stuffed in the back of a drawer. I thought updates would have helped, and gave it some time. Nah. I'm not putting in hours to be able to tell my lights to turn off. I was more interested in ifttt stuff anyhow, and good luck with trying any of that with these.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Shmo

customer_reviews.title: Warranty
customer_reviews.text: All buyers be sure to immediately register the bulbs after buying and receiving them. They do not provide a link but only tell you how to get to their warranty site. Tried registering my bulb after it started turning on and off randomly and the purchase date was July 15, 2017 and todays date is Mar 10, 2019, would not let me register the bulb. I kept getting a message of can not register a purchase in the future. I wouldn't doubt that TP-Link products are for the most part good products, but their warranty process needs improvement on their side, especially when a bulb cost at the time of purchase $34.98
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Long

customer_reviews.title: I used to love these bulbs...
customer_reviews.text: I recommended them to everyone I knew. And then 2 of my 7 bulbs stopped working within 2 years (an LED bulb should last 10-20 years minimum) and I had to contact Kasa Customer service. Worst experience ever. Not at all helpful and their "claim" process is a total nightmare designed to get you to give up so they don't have to issue a replacement. I will never recommend or purchase this companies products again, and I would advise that you don't either.
customer_reviews.author: cherryiice

customer_reviews.title: love these light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: So far, love these light bulbs, there are some features to be aware of in that they are larger, a bit, than the normal light bulb, so some light features will not allow this bulb--such as some lamps, fan lights, etc. Overall, however, they fit most places. Setting up was reasonably easy--had to down load their app, set up--super easy--and then assign to Alexia, mild problems that are quickly taken care of by goggling how too. Love that they are basically dimmable. Complete with timers, and of course, instant access with app or Echo.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: How did we ever live without them?
customer_reviews.text: I love these!!! We have a bulb in every lamp including the basement. I’m not a lazy person but the convince of turning a light on and off without even being in the room is amazing. No need to leave a couple of lights on all the time while you away on vacation. You can turn them off and on with your phone. The Kasa app is easy to use, just take your time and you will figure it out. Customer service is very good if you have trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Land

customer_reviews.title: Easiest smart bulb I've tried.
customer_reviews.text: I already have 2 different smart bulbs in my house. I have GE and Cree and now added these Kasa. OMG, these are so quick and easy to install. I was astounded. They are both dimming and tune-able. Tune-able, I discovered is different from dimming. Dimming is just the brightness. Tune-able means you can make the bulb a soft-white, cool-white or day-light, which makes a big difference in lighting. These bulbs do not need a "hub" which is nice, and work perfectly with my Amazon Alexa. Bulbs can be operated individually or grouped which is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Bennett

customer_reviews.title: I have been very pleased with this wifi connected smart bulb
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased with this wifi connected smart bulb. I used it to replace a dimmable lamp I had on a timer. I needed a timer with daily programmable options, which this bulb gives you the capability. It is very easy to program on the smart phone app. If you want to manually turn the bulb on (during an off period), you just turn the lamp switch off and back on. It comes on full brightness (which is programmable). As others have mentioned, it would be nicer if was able to go dimmer. The dimming capability seems to be between 60W to 30W incandescent equivalent. I wish it would go down towards a 5W bulb at it's dimmest.
customer_reviews.author: ST3V3

customer_reviews.title: The Best Product for College Students
customer_reviews.text: I like to study in my bed and at night so a lot of times I would either have to get up out of a comfy spot to turn off the light or a lot of the times I would accidentally fall asleep with the light on. This led to having bad sleep. Now I have timers on my light so they go off at 1 am every night so if I accidentally leave it on it will go off soon but I accidentally leave it on way less due to the app being so easy to use. I HIGHLY recommend this product. Alexa integration is super easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Aly Childers

customer_reviews.title: Just but them!
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs were SO easy to set up and connect. Total time start to finish to install, connect two bulbs to my WiFi, create their “group” and connect each bulb to Alexa was maybe 20 minutes. I’m thrilled with the adjustments for brightness and color... they blend in perfect to the non-smart bulbs too!
customer_reviews.author: Abbie Brincefield

customer_reviews.title: Smart lights for renters!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great way to Alexa-enabled ceiling lights when you can't mess with the switches or wiring (the joys of renting). And the dial-it-as-you-like-it warmth/coolness means no more fighting with family/roommates/etc. over color levels. There's even a built-in circadian feature that will automatically adjust brightness and blueness (blue is bad for sleeping) based on time of day. The bulbs integrate seamless with my Echo Dot and Alexa, via TP-Link's smarter-than-your-average mobile app. Surprisingly no stars to docked at the time on this overall great product! =^_^=
customer_reviews.author: Pongoxbongo

customer_reviews.title: Too tricky to use in a high ceiling fixture
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a switched ceiling light fixture where older wiring won't allow for a smart switch (which would have been my first choice). The setup was a bit finicky, but I got them going and linked to my Google Home account. But when I forgot and turned them off at the switch out of habit, they seemed to lose the smart link. Not a big deal if they were in a floor lamp or table lamp, but climbing a ladder to unscrew them from the ceiling fixture to reset has been WAY too much trouble. So now they're just two really expensive light bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Good bulb except for life span.
customer_reviews.text: App is very well done with great features. Range of adjustment for brightness and color temp is great. A bit on the dim side for 60 watt equivalent. If bulb had lasted longer, I would have given 4, maybe 5 stars. For the price (and all the LED hype), I expected many years of service. Yes, it went longer than the warranty but it got average usage for a household lamp and lasted 3 1/2 years.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I use this with the Kasa app and Google Home (sorry, Alexa). It has 10-level dimming and can be scheduled to turn on and off at different levels multiple times each day/week as well as voice controlled. One neat little feature I had to discover it that if it's on a switched outlet, you can force it on by toggling the power off and then back on which can be handy if you don't want to use your phone or voice. 800 lumens is marginally bright, I'd like to see a 1600 lumen model.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase....
customer_reviews.text: I'm learning new tricks. I'm learning how to add smart devices to our home--and loving the convenience. I'm "over 65," and I found this item very easy to integrate and set up. It works perfectly. I also have a KASA device (smart plug), and this is another item listed in the app. It's so simple to operate...allows me to tell Alexa to turn the light on or off--but also allows me to turn it on or off while away from home. Easy to set up...easy to use...and functional. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: lindanva

customer_reviews.title: Bedside lamp - turned into automatic sunrise lamp
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't a practically magic set up like others have had... had to start over four times before the kasa app would recognize the bulb, but now that that's done I'm so happy with it. I'ves et it to gradually get bright in the morning like those "sunrise" lamps. Through the kasa app, you can schedule the light to turn on any percentage of dimness that you want. So, I set three timers. It turns on at 50% 20 minutes before my alarm goes off 75% 15 minutes before my alarm 100% 5 minutes before my alarm. Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flexibility in Dimming and lighting helps in many ways
customer_reviews.text: The Smart Lights I bought are great. They are bright enough for everyday use. Yet, they conveniently can be dimmed for use as a night light for one of my kid's rooms and for mood lighting while watching a movie or simply relaxing. This particular light also adjusts from soft white to daylight typed settings, which helps during the strange weather we've been having. Often in Winter people don't get enough sunlight and it affects their mood. This Spring, the crazy weather seems to do that, so it is nice that the light is convertible to give some semblance of daylight on many of these overcast and rainy/snowy days this April in the Midwest.
customer_reviews.author: Renaissance Man n Modern World

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works - good dimmer and hues but ...
customer_reviews.text: Great when it works - good dimmer and hues but every week or more, the connection between Amazon's Alexa and it stops working for several days. For the past week, I haven't been able to access the light via Alexa or the app- rendering the 'smart' lightbulb dumb. Because of all the problems with the bulb and app, we've decided not to purchase this brand of light bulb again.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah F.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Control
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first two bulbs to test. One for the living room and one for the bedroom. They were easy to set up with my Google Home (sorry Alexa) and they worked just fine until Google started having problems connecting, and then my Galaxy S-10 went nuts. But resorting to everybody's favorite tech support technique, I power-cycled both the phone and Google Home and it cleared things up right away. I am planning on buying more, now that I know they work, and I may even switch over to Alexa...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Oleksak

customer_reviews.title: Ordered two, one stopped working after a week
customer_reviews.text: I have three other (less powerful) Kasa smart bulbs, and I wanted two more to really complete my living room. These two came in, set up was easy, and they were definitely brighter (just what I was looking for). However, after just one week of operation, one of them died. I did all the troubleshooting I could (e.g., resetting, trying to reactivate from the app, using a different lamp), but it was completely dead. Pretty frustrating to spend this much on a light to have it just go out. Given my experiences (& the other functional Kasa bulbs I have), I would recommend going with the less powerful (dimmer) option over these more powerful ones.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M

customer_reviews.title: LB120 - Love Them
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are super simple to use and start you down the Smart Home Rabbit Hole with no Hub requireed. I have been using the LB120 tunable white bulbs, I have no need for colors, and I like daylight white, not soft white. After downloading the KASA application the bulbs configured easily, I was able to set various "scenes" or lighting configurations, linked easily with my Google Assistant, and Nest. With IFTTT I have been able to configure all sorts of different IF/Then scenarios such as Unlocking my front door triggers Nest into home mode, which triggers a light in the front room to turn on at 25% power.
customer_reviews.author: John Moss

customer_reviews.title: Work about 30% of the time
customer_reviews.text: For my first attempt at smart lights, I got this product and the Eufy light bulbs. There were good and bad reviews on both and I had plenty of lights so why put my eggs in one basket. I’m glad I did it this way. This product, connected to the Kasa app, disconnects all the time. Even if my WiFi is great, I can no longer control this light through my phone or Alexa because it is suddenly disconnected to WiFi. My rating: useless 20% of the time (so far) . The eufy light bulbs outperform this one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Giraldo

customer_reviews.title: Realiability
customer_reviews.text: Had 4 bulbs and one burned out in less than 3 months. Kasa would not replace it, but Amazon did. Disappointing since the burnt out bulb was in a difficult fixture to access. Had problems reprograming two other bulbs, but Kasa helped me to program my ipad properly and no problems. Actually, fairly simple to program bulbs. Customer support was very courteous. Connects to Alexis and works well with voice commands. Would give more stars, but unsure of bulbs longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan J.

customer_reviews.title: Has quality lowered or did I receive a dud?
customer_reviews.text: Will NOT SYNC! This is my 3rd bulb and first time they’ve felled me. Did not return in time as it was going to be a birthday gift. So glad bought her something better and keftvdefective bulb for self. So disappointing. I’ve used A few Globe bulbs since I bought my original 2 TP for fraction of the cost and liked them better anyway. Guess I will stay with Glibe sorry TP. It was a beautiful thing in the beginning!
customer_reviews.author: myshine

customer_reviews.title: Eight  months and these things are still working great.
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome Lite Bulb’s. I now have a very old smart home. I love to impress my friends, works great with Alexa. They set up pretty easily I must say. I have seven of them working perfectly in my home. ONLY CON: When the power goes out and then comes back on all of the lightbulbs turn on. You will not be able to control them until the WiFi reboots...6 minuets tops.
customer_reviews.author: P36jet

customer_reviews.title: The not so smart light bulb.
customer_reviews.text: I've had nothing but constant frustration with these bulbs. I bought them instead of the hue bulbs because they're much cheaper. Well, you get what you pay for. Between the bulbs turning off immediately after I turn them on with the voice command, the high pitched hum when on and them loosing connection altogether, this has truly been a disappointment. On top of that, the customer support is a joke. The least helpful people I've ever had the displeasure of talking to. I'll be getting the hue bulbs to replace these and I recommend you save yourself the headache and do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A.

customer_reviews.title: Won't interface with google home.  Hopefully they will fix it in a future software release.
customer_reviews.text: Won't work with google home. This appears to be a common bug as I've found hundreds of people searching for a solution on various forums. Google home does have a "TP-Link Kasa" device that you can choose, it takes me to the kasa home page, it accepts my login and says it is linked but it never works. However, it does work from the Kasa app. This isn't much use since I purchased the light for voice control.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I finally decided to jump in and get a smart bulb. The main reason being that I have ...
customer_reviews.text: I finally decided to jump in and get a smart bulb. The main reason being that I have issues waking up in the morning and the idea of having a light that comes on seems to be a good idea. Additionally, the bright light helps during those dark winter months. Overall, I like it. In fact, I bought one for my living room. The app is easy to use, set up took less than 5 minutes. My only complaint is that when you use the dimmer there is a slight buzz that grows to be annoying. So, I have not really been able to use that feature. The pre-sets and programming is great.
customer_reviews.author: MAG

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worked but not indefinitely....Possible fire hazard?
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for two months. Now it is shown as offline with Alexa app. I tried re-installing in both Kasa app and Alexa app and they don't recognize it. When I took the bulb out, I noticed how hot it was. I'm talking burning your fingers hot. An LED bulb should not get so hot. Something is not right here. I'm concerned the electronics in the bulb has failed and it could be a fire hazard.I'd be happy to discuss with someone from TP-Link if they wanted to see what went wrong with my bulb.

customer_reviews.title: I love this light bulb!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how awesome it is to be able to tell Alexa to turn the light to 1% and it instantly happens! No more getting up to turn the light off or on, and I love that the brightness is 100% adjustable. I even use my iPhone app for this bulb to control it from my phone all the time. I think the brightness "presets" on the phone app are very helpful shortcuts. In my opinion, this is a MUST HAVE for anyone with an apple or google phone and a wireless network. AWESOME, AWESOME AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chixdigit

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting and easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bulb in 2018 and it’s still chugging along today. This light bulb and I have been together through three apartments. Admittedly a little difficult to connect to my phone app the first time, but ever since then I just update the WiFi connection every time I move and it’s easy peasy. I have it set to automatically turn on at 6pm and off at 2am in case I forget to turn the lights off before bed.
customer_reviews.author: H. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service and support their products!
customer_reviews.text: I just recently installed the bulb about 90 days ago. Worked fine when paired. Bulb failed to pair today and TP Link support unable to reconnect it to wifi. Even though well out of warranty period TP-Link is going to supply me with a new version at no cost when I send a copy of my Amazon receipt.
customer_reviews.author: Redflash

customer_reviews.title: Pretty reliable - I like this brand.
customer_reviews.text: I have a hue system in my living room and bedroom, and then TP-link swithces in the rest of the house. I use these in the back of the house where I don't need color bulbs, because they're less expensive than the hue white bulbs. I do wish Tp-link would make a dimmer for them but for now, they're in lights that hang from the ceiling but are plugged in across the room from the doorway. I like the TP-link brand, it's pretty economical home automation without a lot of frills, just reliable stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn's Daughter

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic smart bulb...when it works. I bought two of these smart bulbs within the last 12 months and connected it to my echo dot. The bulb was working perfectly for a time and I was extremely pleased. Unfortunately one of the bulbs that I bought stopped working after just 6 months despite claims that it would last way longer than that. I emailed TP Link to report the issue and they didn't even bother responding. I have a few TP Link smart plugs and another smart bulb that all work well so I'm not going to completely slam their products. However, it would be nice if they backed their products.
customer_reviews.author: James Kouledianos

customer_reviews.title: stopped working and has a catch-22 warrenty
customer_reviews.text: My tp-link smart led bulb was purchased nov 3 2017 and quit working on Nov 11, 2018. It has a two year warranty. I had not registered the product so i went to do so because you have to register before making a warranty claim. The registration requires a serial number which is NOT on the bulb. It is supposedly on the packaging. Do you keep light bulb packaging ? I do not.
customer_reviews.author: jackbeanstalk

customer_reviews.title: 1 Year  and 1 Month Later - Bulb Falls Completely Apart
customer_reviews.text: I may have had a faulty bulb from the beginning. I have had to reset it about 20 times by turning the switch on/off many times and reconfiguring. Add my time and the original $35 cost, this is an expensive way for Mom to have a side lamp. I hope the company stands by the warranty. I'll let you know how it turns out. The HUE bulb always works and stays configured as a comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Billie York

customer_reviews.title: Solution of choice for Amazon Alexa home automation.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use with my Echo's (Alexa) Installation was very intuitive and quick. I was up and running in less than 5 minutes. BIG advantage over other Alexa automation options - This did not require the purchase of a separate hub! ($60 - $200 requirement with other solutions). I plan on making TP-Link the brand of choice for the rest of my home automation.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Not A Fan
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with this bulb. It's heavy, the luminance is dim and it doesn't compare to other wifi bulbs I've purchased with the same specs that were half the price and produced better quality lighting. I gave it three stars because, in all fairness, with the Kasa app it connected to wifi without problems, paired with Alexa and technically worked as advertised. I would not recommend it simply because I didn't like the final lighting output.
customer_reviews.author: mzgee

customer_reviews.title: Love them, wish there was a 100W equivalent
customer_reviews.text: Love these bulbs. They are much brighter than other smart bulbs I've tried. I'm not sure why all the smart bulbs are so dim, and no big companies make a 100W equivalent, but these are the best I've tried so far. I've also tried Cree and Philips Hue. What's good about these is that its extremely simple to set up, all you need is the app. This is much better than Phillips Hue bulbs which require ANOTHER inconvenient smart hub taking up an ethernet port. They also work flawlessly with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Tory B.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it - randomly/constantly loses connection
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, these bulbs don’t last. I have two currently - one no longer connects to WiFi/Alexa. The other goes in and out - meaning it connects properly at times and randomly loses all connection (and this happens often). I reached out to their customer service and they have been truly horrible. I’ve been in contact with over two representatives within these past months with no headway to resolve the issue. Avoid purchasing this one as there are definitely better brands out there.
customer_reviews.author: Jayyyyy123

customer_reviews.title: Love them/Hate them
customer_reviews.text: I love thes and I hate these...I have trained the family to use the app most of the time and likewise gotten our routines down enough that the lights turn on and off by themselves. But I have close to 30 of these bulbs now and they have one awful habit — losing their brain when the power goes completely out. We have had 3 or 4 power outages in the last year some for as short as an hour some as long as 8 hours. And each time I have to add the bulbs back to the network. A tiny battery would go along way to improving this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: For $40 it should work for longer than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The bulb worked great for a few months and then all of a sudden it looses the network connection and it keeps loosing the connection. I've tried resetting the device, installing it again as new and it works for a few minutes then it looses its network connection and has a mind of its own. I've resulted to switching the light off via the light switch, but then it doesn't come on. I'm going to contact tplink for a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Ian C

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product on March 8. It is now June 16 and it does not work. I tried contacting the company and all I got for my efforts was frustration. The Chat provided no help and the email that resulted from it was again no help. I do not recommend this product. Try something else. Respectfully, JC
customer_reviews.author: JC M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Smart Light Bulb!
customer_reviews.text: Best smart led bulbs i have ever own, they are pretty easy to install and get them working with Alexa, although i didn't read the description they are yellowish which i didn't like i read somewhere they were soft white, now i know soft white is the yellowish look, i though by dimming i could get the daylight white i wanted. Any way i sill like them, and the elegy monitor help me a lot. I will get more of this but the tunable version which are the ones i could set to daylight.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Ramos Medina

customer_reviews.title: Great lights
customer_reviews.text: Love these Alexa-controlled lights. No hub required, they connect directly to wifi. Easy to set up through their app and easy to integrate into an Alexa-controlled home. I have three right now and they work very well. Alexa gets confused with the light color sometimes (even when just choosing between shades of white) but I'm figuring out the right commands quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: 1 of 2 survived for 11 months.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these bulbs in sync with my Amazon Echo for just under a year now and have been enjoying them. One of them just flickered and stopped working. $25 Is pretty steep for a bulb that works for 11.5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: Wi--fi Light Bulb
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful for turning a light on or off in your home without having to be there. If we are away for a few days, it gives the appearance that we are there. It is also nice to come home to a house with a light on after dark rather than enter into the house when it's pitch black and fumble around looking for the light switch! Wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!!!
customer_reviews.text: My room is bright feels like I'm outside which is perfect in the morning when I have a hard time getting up. I got this and the Tplink with multi colors, I matched them to give me the same lighting and turn this off when I just want mood color for my room. This thing is a life saver when I'm in bed, warm and dozing and just have to tell Google to turn it off. Np turning off both lights at the same time. My friend loves it so much she got three for her room
customer_reviews.author: Bookreader

customer_reviews.title: we were determined to get smart devices that did now require a hub
customer_reviews.text: When we first got an Amazon Dot, we were determined to get smart devices that did now require a hub. Having had a good experience with TP-Link products in the past, I gave these a try. Very happy I did, as they work flawlessly. We've had a few glitches that seemed to be from the TP-Link ecosystem itself, and in each case TP-Link emailed us as registered users that they were aware of the issue and were working to resolve it. And they did, in short order. Similar issues with another brand smart plug we purchased, and issues took far longer for them to resolve, and we heard nothing until after the problem was solved.
customer_reviews.author: R. Shoener

customer_reviews.title: Connection issues.
customer_reviews.text: These lights keep dropping their connection. I moved them within 10 feet of my Nighthawk router (spent a small fortune getting WiFi coverage excellent throughout house even out to pool), and now they seem to hold connection, but other brands hold connections flawlessly throught house and even outside. This brand is the only one that keeps dropping, and it only seems to happen with these bulbs. My TP-Link switches work flawlessly also.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Summerlin

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Control without a Wireless Connection on your phone
customer_reviews.text: Cannot Control without a Wireless Connection on your phone. Originally I loved the TP-Link but when I was traveling and had phone connection but no wireless connection the TP-Link would not work. Honestly, this is worthless if I have to have a wireless connection on my phone to control actions. I also noticed that my phone app would forget connections and I would have to re setup the the connection. Very annoying when I am out of town.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hershberger

customer_reviews.title: Garbage smart bulbs
customer_reviews.text: The LB120 model does not stay connected to the internet, so can't be turned on with the Kass app or a smart speaker, Andy must often won't connect to the app even after turned on manually. They are garbage smart bulbs. Don't waste your money, get the KL model, or a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: N. M. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product, Worse Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bulb and at first it worked perfectly, then suddenly it will no longer connect to the app. I have been in contact with customer service for over three months. All they do is keep telling me to repeat the same procedures that don't work. The last person I spoke with suggested I buy a new phone and see if that would resolve the issue. They will not admit that this is a bad product and they will not replace it. DO NOT BUY this overprice dumb bulb that offers terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good-I bought 2 more
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for about 2 hours....Easily paired to Alexa app, but you MUST set it up in it's own app on your smartphone first. Once that done, Alexa app took 20 seconds to connect. You can say Alexa Set Light at 20%....and it dims perfectly, all the way down to 1% and it looks really nice. The biggest compliant was the packaging, but I'm not a stickler about that it all. Was really hard to get the damn bulb out of the box without ripping it up. I have 2 more on the way for a living room Group.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: DON'T USE in NURSERY or Bedrooms - otherwise easy to configure
customer_reviews.text: Update 07/06/2019: After every power outage, no matter how long, lightbulb defaults to ON when power restored. So when thunderstorms pop up and lights either flicker or go out for 30 minutes, the light will be on - obviously this is awful in a nursery as well as most bedrooms when you'll have a nice wakeup to bright lights. Original Review: Very easy to use and install. Ties into Alexa easily and app works well
customer_reviews.author: Beckster

customer_reviews.title: Work great and make you feel futuristic.  See review.
customer_reviews.text: Work great, and I love the ability to dim them and change the color "tone." I use Kasa to set them up for a morning (brighter, "whiter" light, bulbs at about 40% - we hate mornings and need some time to wake up); daytime (all off); evening (all 100% and warmer light); and night (only one on at 10% for a night light). Kasa is connected to Alexa, so I just tell her "Alexa, turn on "good evening," and I feel like I live in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Widebandid

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, useful functions
customer_reviews.text: This lightbulb was very easy to connect to TP-Link’s Kasa app on my phone and works seamlessly with my Google Home. I no longer have to get up and walk across the room to turn of the light when i’m sitting or in bed. The schedule option within the app is also very useful, especially in the mornings. i set the light to gradually get brighter in the mornings when i’m waking up. The only thing I would change is that I wish the bulb could get a bit brighter. Other than that this product was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Erana Wan

customer_reviews.title: Great Bulbs, Little expensive
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bulbs to replace some Hue Bulbs that I was having an issue with being stable. Sometimes the Hues would not respond. They were located farthest from the Hue hub, which uses ZigBee and not wifi. These now work consistently in that room. It would be nice is they had a nice fade on and off like the hue bulbs, but they are more just like a light switch, on and off right away so gradul faded on and off. Simple setup in app. They are about 10.00 more than Hue bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: sandjam

customer_reviews.title: Have had multiple bulbs for years - so frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bulbs because I was to cheap to buy a system with a hub, just wanted to buy a bulb, plug it in and be done. We have 6 of these and in the last year 2 have gone crazy. Not to mention the ones that work need constant re-attaching to the app which is pretty annoying. Trying to get replacements from the company is a good hour long process, and even then not guaranteed. Do yourself a favor and invest in a solid system that doesn't need constant resetting.
customer_reviews.author: Hopeless in Denver

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love love love the bulbs and plugs. They do exactly what they are supposed to and interacts with Alexa as needed. The Kasa app is also very simple to use and I use it probably more than with Alexa. It’s handy to have when it’s inconvenient or hen speaking is not an option. After buying several of each I’ve not had any trouble setting up even one.
customer_reviews.author: PWtlc

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work after a couple days
customer_reviews.text: worked fine for a few days then simply stopped connecting. Also the app says that remote control is disabled and to connect to wi-fi, but I am connected and it had remote control last time I used the app. I guess I'm supposed to contact customer service judging from the reviews, but this is supposed to add convenience, not nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: Q. Shang

customer_reviews.title: Buy another brand
customer_reviews.text: Where to begin. Installation was a nightmare, as was integration to my smart devices. After finally getting everything set up, it worked reliably for at most a week, and then became less and less reliable when controlling both with smart devices, and it’s own app. Reset the device several times, even contacted the company’s service department - they were absolutely no help. Buy another brand
customer_reviews.author: J. Eugene Plant

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart Bulb
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light bulb from TP-link. Set up was very easy with the Kasa app, no hub needed. There are preset levels of brightness within the app or you can use a slider bar to adjust from 1 - 100. The app also shows the amount of power you are using with the light bulb for the current day, an average over the last 7 days, and an average of the last 30 days. You can also set up a schedule to turn the light on and off. The light output is a very nice warm color and I wold recommend this as a good start for smart bulbs since it is relatively small start up cost.
customer_reviews.author: C. T. Bower

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, but unreliable and bad support
customer_reviews.text: This bulb was great, until it stopped responding to the schedule I attempted to set. I contacted support, and they confirmed it was defective and needed to be replaced, but I was two weeks out of the warranty period so I was told to buy a new one. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Blaser

customer_reviews.title: Worked great while it lasted, which wasn't long
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as advertised and loved the result, until just less than a year. Bulb stopped linking to my tablet and could not restore after many repeated attempts. Still works as a "dumb" bulb, but have to use a separate timer and cannot adjust the color temperature. Not terribly happy with the product and likely will not try another.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Howard

customer_reviews.title: TP-link LED light bulb
customer_reviews.text: I am familiar with the good quality and proper workings of the TP-Link products, the light build worked as expected, no issue and it is one of 5 light bulbs in use, this one is used outside but covered, no issues to date, even when power is lost, frequently in my neighbor - the third world in America, I have the plugs also, 3x and no issues,
customer_reviews.author: C. T. Geoghegan

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because it turns on/off and works with the app. It is, however, a very poor product for use with Alexa. For some reason you cannot just use your home wireless network with Alexa to turn the bulb on and off. You have to configure it for remote access, which means being signed onto Kasa via the cloud (you have to set up a separate account). This connection frequently drops. You then have to go to the app and get remote access back. It is much easier to simply turn on the lamp with a conventional bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent light, terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and from the beginning there's a quirk that when you turn the light on from the switch it turns on to 5% and then 60 seconds later goes to it's pre programmed setting. I contacted customer service which was terrible - had to give them all this information, from the bulb, from my phone, from my router, etc and then was told they'd replace them. Instead of ever contacting me about that I was just put on a lot of marketing lists from them. Nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Doss Freel

customer_reviews.title: Never thought light bulbs would have me excited!
customer_reviews.text: I don't ever have to worry about knocking over my lamp. No more fumbling around for the light switch when I'm still in zombie mode in the mornings. This is all thanks to these awesome smart bulbs with a little help from Alexa via my Echo Dot, which if you don't have one...it's time to jump on the bandwagon. Having voice activated bulbs and being able to control them from anywhere, set them up with a sensor so light turn on when you walk into the house, setting up environments in the Kasa app so the lights dim when you put a movie on and so much more. Buy these bulbs! Do it! Do it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: It works just as advertised. I really like it for it's easy program ability and function. I would get two more for the coach lights next to my garage but they are just a little to expensive for that purpose as we don't usually keep them on. One reason we don't usually keep them on is that we usually forget to turn them off. lol
customer_reviews.author: John Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent to install and ready to work once connected to your WiFi and App. You can schedule specific times during the day to turn on and off, which was my biggest reason to buy it as I always forget to turn lights off in the morning! All this through their Kasa app ! I am about to order two more to just not worry about lights going on and off through the night and morning! This will allow me to forget about one less thing and hopefully save me a few bucks with the electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Really good product I have been using this product for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Really good product I have been using this product for a few months now and it has been working great. But it would appear to lose its programming after some time I'm not too sure how long but after Hurricane Irma it appears to not have kept is programming in terms of what WiFi it was connected to or what time it should turn on on what time it should turn off. Conclusion I like this product but it could be better but it was totally worth the money
customer_reviews.author: AJAMU

customer_reviews.title: It only lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: I am only giving it two stars because it only lasted one year and I really don't use that light that much I have other ones that are 50 watt and I used more and they are still going strong I am going to try another 60 watt hopefully it last as long as they say maybe I got a lemon this time and my next one will be better I really like everything else about the bulb I have them hooked up to Alexa and I love it so I am going to try another one and see what happens I let you know next year hope that it is still going
customer_reviews.author: tommy

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: An addition to the others I own. A half dozen in all.
customer_reviews.author: Holden Wood

customer_reviews.title: Keep finding more uses
customer_reviews.text: I now have three of these bulbs. They all work as expected and I find even more useful ways to use the technology either through the phone app (to turn the lights on for the dog if I am late getting home), setting the lights to timers when I am away or using Alexa to turn them on/off, especially to turn off the lamp on the dresser when I am in bed. One of those things that initially you think, "What do I need that for?" and then find dozens of uses for it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob L.

customer_reviews.title: I like it; a bit pricey
customer_reviews.text: A bit fussy to set up the wireless side, but really works well with the iPhone app. The quality of light is excellent for living room use. The scheduler works well also. Nice mobile app interface. Occasionally it will lose its mind after a power outage, but I've only had to reconfigure the wireless one time in six months and I didn't have to reset the schedule. Looking forward to the prices coming down, as it doesn't yet make sense to replace a lot of lights in the house with these, but the quality (of light and of the product) is all there.
customer_reviews.author: Rus Healy

customer_reviews.title: easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Works well and pairs up with Amazon Echo or Dot almost effortlessly. Did have to look up instructions on setup but had it done paired and working in 5 minutes. Only thing is it can't be in an enclosed light fixture for possible overheating. That wasn't mentioned on the description but was on the bulb. I would give 5 stars if it could be enclosed in a fixture rather than just as a lamp or open fixture bulb.
customer_reviews.author: M. Alleu

customer_reviews.title: Not so useful Wi-Fi feature
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Smart LED Light Bulb, because of the included Wi-Fi feature, sadly the light bulb must be connected to a always-on power source, if someone turns the switch off you have to setup the light bulb again. This happens as well as power failures, TP-Link should do an updated product to fix this issue, it's a bad experience having to setup the bulb every time. When it's always on, the bulb works well and the software has nice and really easy to use features.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Carcamo

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: Twice in one week all the bulbs dropped off from the app. You have to go back Re-set them all to put back on and when you do that you lose the history. Maybe this is solvable, but I just spent an hour trying to reach CS they make it a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Queen

customer_reviews.title: Better than installing a digital light switch and NO HUB REQUIRED!
customer_reviews.text: No hub required! It works perfectly, just screw it in and download the app. I use it for my front porch and the app has a sunset to sunrise feature so that the light turns on every night at sunset and turns off every morning at sunrise. I priced it out and its about the same price as installing a new digital light switch with a timer and the smart light bulb is WAY easier to install.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Snyder

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link Products are just AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Received today and installed in no time. With Alexa (Echo from Amazon) you can Turn on/off and tell Alexa to set the brightness to a desired %. The hue is adjustable as well. TP-Link works with a mobile App that must be (easily) configured which adds them to your wifi, then you can configure with Alexa's app. Easy Peasy specially after the 1st one. Don't know yet about life, but these integrated perfectly with my wifi and Echo and that is why I bought them. I am truly a FAN of the TP-Link products!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Miller

customer_reviews.title: and it's easy to get working
customer_reviews.text: "Alexa, set the bedroom lamp to 15% brightness." Yep, you can do that, and it's easy to get working. I'll be buying more of these or their cousins in the near future. The one thing I haven't been able to get Alexa to do is change the color temperature, but that's easy enough with the Kasa app. I have a couple of the smart plugs too, and so with a $150 investment including an Echo Dot I can control lighting in key areas of my home remotely with a smartphone or by voice with Alexa. Will buy again with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bulb on Feb 4th. The setup was fairly easy. However, It's been barely a month, the Bulb is already dead. It cannot be detected by KASA, which is the app for the bulb. I try to unplug the power and reboot the bulb, it just doesn't work. I'm not sure if it's bad luck or it's simply a quality problem. I'm very disappointed at this purchase. Oh by the way, the so called 24/7 service number on their package never reaches anywhere. Whatever you do, don't buy this thing. It is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Fiona.W

customer_reviews.title: High cost per bulb/year
customer_reviews.text: I have owned four TP-Link Kasa bulbs. Two LB-110's (2700k) and two LB-120's (tunable white). Three of the four failed just outside the two--year warranty. So much for the 22.8 year lifetime (maybe unused in a box). They worked very well and I was quite happy with them. However, with their relatively short life, the TCO or cost per bulb/year is just unacceptable. I have had no issues with my five TP-Link smart outlets.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Works great, can dim from app only (not from Alexa)
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this light bulb so far. Set up was a bit involved (especially connecting with Alexa), but after I set it up works like a charm. Almost never goes off line, Alexa recognizes is and turns on/off. I wish Alexa could also dim its brightness, but it can only turn it on or off. You can dim its brightness from the Kasa app, but having this feature synch with Alexa would have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Peppi_DP

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this trash brand.
customer_reviews.text: Just a regular bulb. After a power outage my bulb no longer responds to anything. No amount of resetting or reinstalling works. Huge PIA. Total peice of trash. Exactly why I was apprehensive about getting a smart bulb. I will be buying from Phillips, an actually recognizable brand instead of garbage tp link, in the future. I'm not going to reinstall everything and change wifi settings just because you make a terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lighting and Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to setup this light bulb with Alexa. In fact, I have now replaced all my Edison bulbs with these in the house. Next, the garage! :)
customer_reviews.author: El Conquistador

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and setup. Easy to use in app and Google home
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Google home. Color choices are clear. Has auto setting to dim through evening. Once it starts getting a little lower, I can hear a sight buzz though. My ears are sensitive and I'm right next to it. Maybe it's me...
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Liloia

customer_reviews.title: Bulb stop communicating after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of TP-Link Kasa Smart Bulbs. Bothe bulbs worked great for three months when one bulb stop communicating. The light still works but with no control. I will send the uncontrollable bulb back.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby G.

customer_reviews.title: Light keeps coming off of network.
customer_reviews.text: While this was a cheaper and supposed easier option, I’ll most likely return it. The lamp keeps coming off the network. Defeats the purpose of home automation if I have to keep turning on the lamp physically. Maybe there is a learning curve to these but I’ll be shopping for a better, more known option.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Does not respond/connect to alexa
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY, I have two other kasa products, these are links that plug directly into the wall and have been using them for over 2-3 months with no problems at all. With this the second day after installation It would not respond to my alexa commands. Took me over 5 minutes to get on fiddling with my alexa and kasa app. This product sucks and is way more trouble than its worth, looking for my refund asap.
customer_reviews.author: Conner

customer_reviews.title: Where did it go?
customer_reviews.text: I installed it, and, every two days or so, I have to reinstall it. Completely drops out of the system. I will not be buying another. Not worth the time and effort to send back. ***update***16 Feb 19, the seller have a full refund. My review of the product remains unchanged, it doesn't work, but i do note the seller took care of the matter.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a good stuff. I've used it for a long time. Not any issues. But I don't know how to discuss it. I just want to clean up the review. Because when I look at the review which hasn't reviewed that I will feel uncomfortable. That's it.
customer_reviews.author: Yima

customer_reviews.title: Works Directly With Amazon Echo
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these smart LED light bulbs because they work directly with the Amazon Echo without the need for an intermediary hub to control them. We have one it our great room and another one in a room that faces the street. A simple "Alexa, Lamp On or Off" is all it takes to control the one we use the most. The best thing is the scheduling feature. You can setup schedules to turn the bulbs on and off when you are away so that it appears somebody is home. WE LOVE THIS FEATURE, and it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia

customer_reviews.title: No more pull chain light
customer_reviews.text: I love this bulb. I used it in a pull chain light fixture. Wish I had thought of it sooner. It's brighter than the bulb I had in it for peak brightness. I love changing the brightness and color temperatures. So now it doesn't have to be the same all the time. works great with Alexa. easy to setup. I was worried the metal shade would be a problem with the wifi but it's not
customer_reviews.author: Michael

product_meta.title: Kasa Smart Light Bulb by TP-Link – WiFi Bulbs, No Hub Required, Old Version, Works with Alexa & Google (LB110)
product_meta.description: Style:Soft White Dimmable, A19Control your lighting from anywhere with the LB110. The smart bulb installs as easily as a standard light bulb, and connects to your home Wi-Fi in no time through the free Kasa app. Kasa also lets you manage your lights with your smartphone or tablet, including adjusting brightness, setting schedules and scenes, and tracking energy used. For added convenience, you can use your voice to control the LB110 when paired with Amazon Alexa. Protocols Supported: IEEE 802.11b/g/n; System Requirement: Android 4.1 or higher iOS 9.0 or higher; Wireless Type: 2.4GHz 1T1R.
feature_bullets: Control from anywhere: Turn electronics on or off from anywhere with your smartphone using the kasa app (compatible w/ android & ios)
Voice Control: Works with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant and MicroSoft Cortana supported devices for a hands free experience
Dimmable: Dim brightness to customize lighting and suit your mood; The LB110 has 800 lumens brightness and dimmable White light
Kasa scenes & schedules; Schedule the smart bulb to automatically turn on and off when away
Note: Requires a secured 2.4 GigaHertz WiFi network connection

specifications.Included Components: Smart Wi-Fi LED Bulb LB110, Quick Installation Guide
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,513 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
